thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn calls out Mesut Ozil over Arsenal wage demands: Can you just live with what you've got?
thread.title_full: Jeremy Corbyn calls out Mesut Ozil over Arsenal wage demands: Can you just live with what you've got?

author: James Benge
title: Jeremy Corbyn calls out Mesut Ozil over Arsenal wage demands: Can you just live with what you've got?
text:
Chelsea boss Conte interrupts press conference to try reporter's cake 
Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn has entered the row over footballers’ pay, urging Arsenal star Mesut Ozil to “live with what he has got”. 
Both Ozil and Alexis Sanchez have 18 months to run on their current contracts and are demanding £290,000-a-week, a sum that would put them on par with the league’s top earner Paul Pogba, before they put pen to paper on extensions. 
The duo are Arsenal’s most important players – between them they have contributed 19 goals and eight assists in the Premier League – and their departure would be a brutal blow to fans at the Emirates. 
Among those is Corbyn, who has supported around 100 early day motions relating to Arsenal during his parliamentary career and has consistently offered his backing to Arsene Wenger. Corbyn calls for salary cap in attack on 'grotesque difference' in pay 
Earlier this week the Labour leader called for a maximum wage limit on top earners, though it has since been claimed by an aide that he “misspoke”, but there were no exceptions even for a player as talented as Ozil. 
“I do [think he’s paid too much],” Corbyn told the Andrew Marr Show before relaying a message to Ozil. “Mesut thanks for your game, you are a fantastic player, but can you just live with what you’ve got at the moment? In Pictures | Swansea vs Arsenal | 14/01/2017 In Pictures | Swansea vs Arsenal | 14/01/2017 1/25
